visual.name: projectOrgChart
visual.description: The Project Org Chart Visual for Power BI enables dynamic, data-driven project hierarchies. Easily assign roles, manage multi-level structures, and customize categories for clear, always up-to-date project team visualization—without manual updates.

dataRoles.name: project
dataRoles.description: Represents individual projects, subprojects or work packages. This is used to group and visualize teams or tasks specific to each project level.

dataRoles.name: name
dataRoles.description: The full name of individuals in the project or organization, linking them to specific roles and responsibilities within the chart.

dataRoles.name: jobTitle
dataRoles.description: Specifies the job titles associated with individuals in the org chart, helping identify their responsibilities within the project or hierarchy.

dataRoles.name: image
dataRoles.description: Specifies the Profile Image associated with individuals in the org chart, helping identify their responsibilities within the project or hierarchy.

dataRoles.name: department
dataRoles.description: Categorizes individuals or roles by their department, function, or any other classification relevant to the organization.

dataRoles.name: hierarchy
dataRoles.description: Defines the primary organizational hierarchy or structure, typically used for top-level groupings such as boards or departments.

dataRoles.name: auxGroup
dataRoles.description: Used to define auxiliary or support roles in a project, such as project management, finance, legal, and other supporting functions.

dataRoles.name: projectRelation
dataRoles.description: Project name that's related to the Hierarchy or Additional Role Groups entries.

dataRoles.name: tooltip
dataRoles.description: Additional fields to display in tooltips
